abstract: Federal court strikes down redistricting plan in Virginia, saying legislators have lumped black voters disproportionately in favor of districts that tend to support Republican candidates.
lead_paragraph: A federal court has again ruled that Virginia legislators packed too many black voters into one congressional district in order to make adjacent districts safer for Republican incumbents.

headline.main: Virginia: Court Again Invalidates Redistricting Plan
headline.print_headline: Virginia: Court Again Invalidates Redistricting Plan

snippet: A federal court has again ruled that Virginia legislators packed too many black voters into one congressional district in order to make adjacent districts safer for Republican incumbents.
